body:
This PR is ready to be merged

Final Commit Message:
Fix for parallel instances stoppable API incorrectly reordering the zoneList when a user provides their own zone_order.

Thanks a lot for timely review, @junkaixue. Appreciate.

Commit message: There was a logic bug in WAGED n=n+1, fixed that and added log statements.

Commit message: Metaclient - Leader election - leader change event notification

This PR is ready to be merged

Final Commit Message:
Fix stoppable parallel instances API swallowing error thrown when processing stoppable checks, add proper error handling for RESTConfig getBaseUrl method(asserts may not throw AssertionException if assertEnabled is specifically enabled in jvm config), and remove assumption that instance name contains port information while maintaining backwards compatibility.

PR approved by @xyuanlu 
Commit message: Lattice Puppy Stress Test Race Condition Fix and Code Cleanup

Thanks a million @junkaixue for your review.  This PR is reviewed and approved by Junkai.

Commit message: Lattice LockClient LockInfoSerializer Implementation

Thanks @arminbalalaie. I think Helix currently support tagging between instances and resources. So Apache Pinot uses this way to achieve multi-tenancy.

Also if you would like to have different instance capacity, you can check WAGED rebalance helix introduced. It is serving for different multi dimension evaluation of partition/instances for assignment.

This change is ready to be merged. Approved by @Marcosrico 

Commit message: Add stress test for Metaclient leader election

Thanks @GrantPSpencer for the review. This change has been reviewed and approved by @GrantPSpencer 
Commit message: reduce the log verbosity for 2 statements

This PR is ready to be merged

Final Commit Message:
Add InstanceConfigs inputField to allow overriding the existing InstanceConfigs for /partitionAssignment API.
A general and maybe dumb question, how would there be double leader? Does the old leader still acts as leader while disconnected from the metadata store, meanwhile a real new leader is elected?

> A general and maybe dumb question, how would there be double leader? Does the old leader still acts as leader while disconnected from the metadata store, meanwhile a real new leader is elected? Thanks @qqu0127 for review! Before this PR, client send `leader gone` event to registered listeners when it gets `Node deleted` event. In case of disconnect, client will only get `Node deleted` event when it reconnected to ZK. If disconnect time is longer than session expire time, a new leader will already be selected and client gets `Node deleted` event after that. In this change we proactively send `leader gone` event to registered listeners when we get disconnected event and touch leader ZNode when it reconnect.
Closing accidentally create PR....Sorry for confusing.

This PR has been reviewed and approved by @desaikomal and @rahulrane50 and is ready to be merged

Final Commit Message:
Adjusted decrementing the missingTopStatePartitionsBeyondThresholdGuage when top-state Instance recovers after the threshold failure.
Could you please post the PR to branch `ApplicationCLusterManager ` ?

Pull request approved by @xyuanlu

Implement the on-demand rebalance service that performs rebalancing for offline or disabled instances without respecting the delay configuration

This change is ready to be merged. Approved by @zpinto

commit message: Add CI test config for ApplicationClusterManager branch
Please create another PR to track the Periodic pipeline related change.

This PR is reviewed and approved by @desaikomal .
Commit message: Fixes #2590 Removed resetting of the missingTopStatePartitionsBeyondThresholdGauge to avoid incorrect accounting.

This change is approved by @MarkGaox 
Commit message: Fix NPR error in test for TestDelayedAutoRebalanceWithRackaware

This PR is reviewed and approved by @xyuanlu. Thanks for the review!
Commit message: Add on-demand rebalance API

This PR is ready to be merged.

Final Commit Message:
In some cases TopStateHandoffReportStage is taking a very long portion of the total pipeline execution time. In order to speed up the total pipeline execution time, we will make TopStateHandoffReportStage async since it is simply computing metrics and reporting without adding to ClusterEvent.
@MarkGaox, I'm curious if this API is coming about for Pinot or some other system. I linked a Pinot issue to your PR as well

Hi, thanks for reaching out. It hinges on whether Pinot is willing to adopt the latest version of Helix. Typically, we avoid imposing the latest version on clients and rather prioritize their willingness to opt into it.
Just wondering, any particular reason why we want to change to debug level? From this PR https://github.com/apache/helix/pull/2603#discussion_r1302269166, it looks like the log is not frequent?
